World.headline: Trump Threatens to Take Greenland 'The Hard Way'
World.summary: Donald Trump reiterated his stance that the U.S. needs Greenland and threatened to acquire it 'the hard way' if necessary. He justified this by stating the U.S. must prevent Russia and China from gaining control of the strategic territory. This statement highlights ongoing geopolitical tensions surrounding Greenland's ownership.
key_points: Donald Trump threatened to take Greenland by force if diplomatic means fail.
He argues Greenland is strategically vital for the U.S. to counter Russia and China.
This reflects escalating international geopolitical interests in the Arctic region.

World.headline: Courtroom Chaos as ED-Mamata Faceoff Leads to Judge Walkout
World.summary: A dramatic confrontation unfolded in court between India's Enforcement Directorate (ED) and West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, causing significant disruption. The heated exchange led to the judge ultimately walking out of the courtroom. This incident highlights the intense political and legal tensions in the region.
key_points: A standoff between the ED and Mamata Banerjee created chaos in court.
The judge walked out due to the escalating courtroom drama.
The incident underscores heightened political and legal friction in India.

The surrendered individuals will now be integrated into rehabilitation programs.

World.headline: Trump Declares US Control Over Venezuelan Oil Firm Operations
